intro: Ochropteris angusta, commonly known as the narrow fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces small, clustered sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its delicate appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
